citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: FOCUS - Fisheries Oceanography Cooperative Users System - Users Guide

descript.abstract: Because of increased pressure on living marine resources, scientific interest is being focused on relationships between environmental fluctuations and the interannual variability of fish stocks. Understanding these relationships demands the availability of comprehensive environmental data sets, in a user friendly form and on time and space scales that are applicable to fisheries. In response to this need, NOAA's Northwest and Alaska Fisheries Center (NWAFC) and Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL) have jointly developed a data base management system known as FOCUS (Fisheries Oceanography Cooperative Users System) for use in investigations on ocean-fishery variability and interactions in the Bering Sea and Gulf of Alaska. The system offers the ability to associate, join and directly analyze two or more data types from various environmental and fisheries data sets and computer systems in order to develop statistical summaries, time series plots, contour plots and other integrated data analyses. FOCUS establishes software compatibility among existing data sets and analysis packages within a distributed data base environment. This report describes the operation of FOCUS from a user's point of view.
descript.purpose: To create a user's guide on the FOCUS - Fisheries Oceanography Cooperative Users System and it's understanding.

theme.themekey: FOCUS - Fisheries Ocean. Coop. User Sys.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
